text: al-Khaṭīb ash-Shirbīniy (, d. 1570) was a Shafi'i scholar from Egypt, who wrote many works on exegesis, fiqh, the Arabic language, and other Islamic disciplines. He was initially living in the Dakahlia Governorate, his birthplace, before migrating to Cairo in which he lived for the rest of his life. == See also == * List of Ash'aris and Maturidis ==References== Category:Asharis Category:Shafi'is Category:Quranic exegesis scholars Category:Sunni Muslim scholars Category:16th-century Muslim scholars of Islam Category:16th-century jurists Category:1570 deaths
title: Al-Khatib al-Shirbini
